revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Buffalo |model=WBMR-HP |revision=-GN |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Gemtek |manuf_model=WADI-128GN |availability=now |fcc_date=04/13/2009 |fcc_id=FDI-09101556-0 |type=wireless router,dsl modem |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Infineon |cpu1_model=PSB 50601;PSB 50601 HL, V1.1, (AMAZON-SE); |ram1_brand=Hynix |wi1_chip1_brand=Ralink |wi1_chip1_model=RT3070 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=1 |wi1_rxchains=1 |wi1_sstreams=1 |eth_cpu=true |sw_brand=IC+ |sw_model=IP175C |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |flags=ADSL2+ |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid=XXXXXXXXXXXX |default_ssid_regex=^[A-F0-9]{12}$ |default_ip=192.168.11.1 |default_user=root }} "WADI-128GN-V01" and "ENG-X10-9601R RoHS" is silkscreened on the board. *OEM: [[Gemtek]] WADI-128GN (WADI-128GN-V01)
The default SSID format is presumed to be the same of most other '''Buffalo''' :products (the MAC address w/ no delimiters and upper case hex digits).
*[http://www.pcworld.idg.com.au/review/networking_wireless_voip/buffalo/airstation_wbmr-hp-gn/356902 Review on '''PCWorld''' Australia] (also pictures)
